author: Adam Reiss
description: The women victimized by Epstein say their suffering is being sidelined as political infighting over Trump's decision to disavow conspiracy theories takes center stage.
title: Epstein victims say the Trump administration's handling of the case adds to their anguish

author: Rob Wile
description: After political wrangling, three crypto bills favored by Donald Trump have received key approvals on Capitol Hill, with one signed by the president into law.
title: Investors cheer new crypto law while critics warn of potential for crisis

author: The Politics Desk
description: President Donald Trump’s first year back in the White House has coincided with some sharp changes in allied countries’ assessments of the importance of Chinese economic ties.
title: As Trump pursues his trade agenda, other countries' views shift on ties with China

author: Evie Steele
description: McDonald's brought back the popular Snack Wrap as it suffers sagging sales in the U.S.
title: Snack Wrap frenzy briefly leaves McDonald's short on lettuce

description: President Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit against the Wall Street Journal, its parent companies, and a former Fox News executive over a report linking him to a letter and drawing allegedly sent to Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Trump sues WSJ over Epstein report and pushes to unseal grand jury files

author: Chloe Atkins
description: The libel lawsuit was filed the same day that the Justice Department asked a court to unseal grand jury transcripts tied to Jeffrey Epstein's case.
title: Trump sues Wall Street Journal's publisher and 2 reporters over Epstein article

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: The company linked to two people seen canoodling at a Coldplay concert in Massachusetts said it is launching an investigation into the incident after people online speculated the man in the video is the company’s CEO.
title: Company linked to couple kissing at Coldplay concert says it's investigating incident

author: Rob Wile
description: Skydance CEO David Ellison told the FCC he wants “American storytelling” at Paramount while touting a new, “unbiased” editorial direction for CBS News.
title: Paramount bidder Skydance plays patriotism card in push for deal OK

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Rapper Nicki Minaj reached out to Florida congresswoman Anna Paulina Luna for help over alleged threats a DJ and streamer made in response to her social media beef with SZA.
title: Nicki Minaj asks Florida congresswoman for help over alleged threat amid feud with SZA

author: Didi Martinez
description: The Venezuelan immigrants whom the Trump administration had sent to a notorious mega-prison in El Salvador have been flown to Venezuela, according to El Salvador President Nayib Bukele
title: Men the Trump administration had sent to notorious El Salvador prison are exchanged in prisoner swap

author: Rebecca Cohen
description: Police are investigating after a noose was found at the construction site of the Tennessee Titans' new football stadium this week, a spokesperson for the Metro Nashville Police Department said.
title: Noose found at site of Tennessee Titans' new stadium

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: The group has received reports this week of detainees from the island sent to the Florida facility and allegations of "rights violations and dehumanizing treatment."
title: Puerto Rico ACLU denounces transfer of immigrant detainees to 'Alligator Alcatraz'

description: Los Angeles County Sheriff Robert Luna said the FBI is investigating the cause of an explosion that killed three Arson/Explosives officers at a LASD training facility. Luna added that the explosion was an "isolated" incident and the public is not in danger.
title: 'No threat to this community': LA County Sheriff offers details on fatal explosion

author: Anagilmara Vílchez
description: The administration launched the CBP Home app to provide support for immigrants to leave voluntarily, but some say they haven't gotten this help.
title: Some immigrants want to self-deport but they’re hitting roadblocks and confusion

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: The “Gen Z stare” is a blank look Zoomers give to their elders. It’s the latest intergenerational spat to take over TikTok.
title: Gen Z is staring at you. It may be more than just a quirk.

author: Sahil Kapur
description: In some cases, GOP members of Congress have said legislation they supported will need to be fixed down the road. In others, they've backed off explicit threats to vote "no."
title: Republicans keep voting for bills they say they don't like

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A girl dramatically reacting to an insect may have caused the stampede that unfolded at an Atlanta metro station as crowds were leaving Beyoncé’s concert
title: Insect may have caused stampede following Beyoncé's Atlanta concert

description: At least three people have been killed after an explosion at a Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department training facility. NBC News' Aaron Gilchrist has early details on the incident.
title: Fatal explosion at Los Angeles County Sheriff's training facility

author: David K. Li
description: At least three people were killed in an apparent explosion at a Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department training facility on Friday morning, authorities said
title: At least 3 dead in reported explosion at Los Angeles County Sheriff's training facility

author: Mirna Alsharif
description: Over 140 passengers and crew members aboard a Royal Caribbean International cruise ship were sickened by a gastrointestinal illness that led to vomiting and diarrhea, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
title: Over 140 people on Royal Caribbean cruise sickened by stomach bug outbreak

description: Watch live coverage as President Trump holds a signing ceremony for the GENIUS Act, which aims to create a regulatory framework for cryptocurrency.
title: Trump holds signing ceremony for cryptocurrency bill

author: Cory Fernandez
description: Learn how to get rid of fruit flies, mosquitoes, gnats and other pests, with guidance from extermination experts. This is the best, and fastest way, to do it.
title: How to get rid of flies and other insects at home, according to pros

author: David K. Li
description: A one-time police officer and former Baltimore Orioles minor leaguer died over the weekend helping to rescue swimmers caught in a rip current off the South Carolina coast.
title: Former Baltimore Orioles prospect Chase Childers dies saving swimmers in South Carolina

description: NBC News' Julie Tsirkin reports on the House of Representatives passing a bill cutting $9 billion in spending that had already been approved, including cuts to foreign aid funds for services like NPR and PBS.
title: House passes spending package cutting foreign aid and funds for NPR and PBS

author: Matt Lavietes
description: Secretary of Homeland Security Kristi Noem announced on Thursday that the TSA will open security lanes dedicated to families and military service members.“Families on the Fly" will create dedicated security lines for families with small children and give families a $15 discount for TSA pre-check enrollment, Noem said at a press conference at Nashville International Airport.
title: Kristi Noem announces new TSA security lane for families and military members

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: It will be a hot and wet weekend for large swathes of the U.S. with flood watches and intense heat wave warnings in place
title: Millions under flood watches and heat wave warnings across U.S.

description: Trump directed AG Pam Bondi last night to release "pertinent" grand jury testimony in the criminal case of the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
title: AG Pam Bondi says DOJ will seek to unseal Epstein grand jury records

description: The TSA will now add lanes at security checkpoints dedicated to families and military members. The program called Families on the Fly started as a trial run in Orlando, Florida, and will now expand to other areas where families often travel with children.
title: TSA to Add Security Lanes for Families and Military Members

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: A $9 billion rescissions package could jeopardize the future of hundreds of local NPR and PBS stations.
title: Trump denies letter to Epstein and Stephen Colbert's 'Late Show' to end: Morning Rundown

description: Around 17 million Americans are under flood watches as they head into another soggy summer weekend. It comes as a heat wave is causing sweltering conditions from the South to the Northeast, impacting 10 million. NBC’s George Solis reports and TODAY’s Dylan Dreyer tracks the latest forecast.
title: Flood Watches and Heat Wave Impact Millions around US

description: Amid mounting pressure from his closest allies, President Donald Trump posted that he asked Attorney General Pam Bondi to “produce any and all pertinent grand jury testimony, subject to court approval” relating to the Jeffrey Epstein case. It comes as a bombshell report from The Wall Street Journal that describes a birthday album that contains letters from Trump and dozens of other friends and associates. NBC’s Ryan Nobles reports for TODAY.
title: Trump Calls for Release of Epstein Testimony Amid Fierce Uproar

author: Rohan Nadkarni
description: Last August, the WNBA announced that Indianapolis — home of the Indiana Fever and Caitlin Clark — would host the league’s All-Star weekend this season for the first time
title: Why Caitlin Clark's latest injury is terrible timing for the WNBA

author: The Associated Press
description: A towering mural in France of the Statue of Liberty covering her eyes is racking up millions of views online with its swipe at U.S. President Donald Trump’s immigration and deportation policies.
title: New mural in France shows Statue of Liberty covering eyes in swipe at Trump

author: Gretchen Morgenson
description: Stephanie Nixdorf's insurance company declined to cover a drug to treat her arthritis. That changed after she sent an appeal letter crafted with help from AI.
title: AI is helping patients fight insurance company denials: 'It is wild'

author: Erika Edwards
description: On Wednesday, President Donald Trump said Coca-Cola agreed to start sweetening its products with cane sugar, rather than high-fructose corn syrup.
title: As Trump pushes for cane sugar in Coca-Cola, is it really better than corn syrup?

author: Berkeley Lovelace Jr.
description: People who get health insurance through the Affordable Care Act could soon see their monthly premiums sharply increase as subsidies expire and insurers propose a major premium hike for 2026.
title: Cost of Obamacare expected to soar as subsidies expire and insurers hike premiums

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: As potential candidates test themselves out in South Carolina, state Democrats are considering whom they want to see leading them into a post-Donald Trump era. In conversations with more than a dozen Democrats across the state, two themes emerged: They want someone ready to “fight,” but they also want someone who can appeal across party lines.
title: Democrats in a key state want to see their leaders 'fight' — and reach across party lines

author: Matt Bradley
description: In the birthplace of Christianity, churches and communities are coming under attack from Jewish, Israeli settlers
title: In the birthplace of Christianity, churches and communities are coming under attack from Jewish settlers

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: Media advocates say the cuts could have an especially harmful impact on rural Americans. Republican lawmakers have accused NPR and PBS of having a liberal bias.
title: Public broadcasters say GOP funding cuts could be 'devastating' to local media and make Americans less safe

author: Scott Wong
description: Popular global HIV/AIDS program PEPFAR has been spared as Congress passes a package with billions of dollars in spending cuts for Trump to sign into law.
title: U.S. program to combat HIV/AIDS survives Trump's latest round of cuts

description: President Trump says that he wants Coca-Cola to switch from using corn syrup to cane sugar. NBC News' Ellison Barber talks to Editor-in-Chief of Investopedia Caleb Silver on the potential change and the response from Coca-Cola.
title: President Trump seeks to switch Coca-Cola from corn syrup to cane sugar

description: GOP leaders are working on a plan to send the Senate-approved rescissions package to the floor tonight.
title: House vote on spending cuts stalls in committee

author: Nnamdi Egwuonwu
description: The Wall Street Journal reported that Trump was among dozens of associates who wrote Epstein a letter in 2003 to mark his 50th birthday. Trump said he will sue the newspaper.
title: Trump denies writing letter to Jeffrey Epstein with drawing of a naked woman

author: Kimmy Yam
description: Two married Iranian students at Louisiana State University were released from Immigration and Customs Enforcement custody this week after they were arrested in June in what their attorneys describe as a “ruse” orchestrated by government agents
title: Two Iranian students released after ICE arrested them in a 'ruse,' their lawyers said

author: Phil Helsel
description: LOS ANGELES —A man was charged Thursday with murder and burglary counts in the fatal shootings of “American Idol” music supervisor Robin Kaye and her husband in their Los Angeles home last week, the district attorney’s office said
title: Man charged in killing of 'American Idol' music supervisor and husband
